response_metadata.response_text:
{
  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent and to establish and appropriate funds for a Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_3] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years. [CHUNK_6]",
  "appropriations": "The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [CHUNK_7] These funds are for mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services and equipment. [CHUNK_7] The appropriation also provides for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_7]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "This measure has been amended by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years. [CHUNK_20] A sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit has been set for June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "agency_impact": "The Judiciary is now responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_6] The appropriation includes funding for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the pilot program. [CHUNK_8]",
  "economic_impact": "",
  "policy_impact": "This measure has been amended by codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii. [CHUNK_5] Language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in other circuits has been deleted. [CHUNK_9] The effective date has been changed to July 1, 2025, and the sunset date for the Kona pilot program is changed to June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "revenue_sources": "",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_7] The duration of this pilot program has been changed from three years to two years. [CHUNK_6] Funding is for mental health, substance abuse treatment, other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position. [CHUNK_7] The sunset date for the Kona pilot program is June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10] The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is now a permanent program. [CHUNK_3]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is made permanent, which will have ongoing fiscal implications. [CHUNK_3] The Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit is set to be discontinued with a sunset date of June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit was changed from three years to two years. [CHUNK_6] Appropriations are now specified, with $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [CHUNK_7] The Judiciary is now responsible for providing mental health services for the Kona pilot program. [CHUNK_6] The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit has been made permanent. [CHUNK_3] The requirement for the Judiciary to submit a report on the costs of expanding the pilot program to other circuits has been deleted. [CHUNK_9] A sunset date of June 30, 2027, has been established for the Kona pilot program. [CHUNK_10]"
}

  "overview": "The purpose of this measure is to make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent and to establish and appropriate funds for a Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_3] Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years.   "appropriations": "The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [CHUNK_7] The appropriation also provides for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_7]",
  "assumptions_and_methodology": "This measure has been amended by changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years. [CHUNK_20] A sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit has been set for June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "agency_impact": "The Judiciary is now responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_6] The appropriation includes funding for the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the pilot program. [CHUNK_8]",

  "policy_impact": "This measure has been amended by codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii. [CHUNK_5] Language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in other circuits has been deleted. [CHUNK_9] The effective date has been changed to July 1, 2025, and the sunset date for the Kona pilot program is changed to June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "revenue_sources": "",
  "six_year_fiscal_implications": "The measure appropriates $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027 for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit. [CHUNK_7] The duration of this pilot program has been changed from three years to two years. [CHUNK_6] Funding is for mental health, substance abuse treatment, other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position. [CHUNK_7] The sunset date for the Kona pilot program is June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10] The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is now a permanent program. [CHUNK_3]",
  "operating_revenue_impact": "",
  "capital_expenditure_impact": "",
  "fiscal_implications_after_6_years": "The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit is made permanent, which will have ongoing fiscal implications. [CHUNK_3] The Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit is set to be discontinued with a sunset date of June 30, 2027. [CHUNK_10]",
  "updates_from_previous_fiscal_note": "The duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit was changed from three years to two years. [CHUNK_6] Appropriations are now specified, with $514,900 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 (HB727_CD1_.HTM.txt) for fiscal year 2026-2027. [CHUNK_7] The Judiciary is now responsible for providing mental health services for the Kona pilot program. [CHUNK_6] The Women's Court Program in the First Circuit has been made permanent. [CHUNK_3] The requirement for the Judiciary to submit a report on the costs of expanding the pilot program to other circuits has been deleted. [CHUNK_9] A sunset date of June 30, 2027, has been established for the Kona pilot program. [CHUNK_10]"

chunk_details.chunk_text: CCR58 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 58 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 727 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE WOMEN'S COURT," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of

of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to (1) Make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent; (2) Establish and appropriate funds for a three-year Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the

Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference

Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii; (2) Requiring the Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under

Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (3) Changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900

Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 for fiscal year 2026-2027 for mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot

drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (5) Deleting language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court

the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit; (6) Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025; (7) Changing the sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third

Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit to June 30, 2027; and (8) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report,

your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D.

in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE ____________________________ KARL RHOADS Chair ____________________________ DAVID A. TARNAS Co-Chair ____________________________ LYNN DECOITE Co-Chair ____________________________ LISA KITAGAWA
A. TARNAS Co-Chair ____________________________ LYNN DECOITE Co-Chair ____________________________ LISA KITAGAWA Co-Chair

CCR58 CONFERENCE COMMITTEE REP. NO. 58 Honolulu, Hawaii , 2025 RE: H.B. No. 727 H.D. 1 S.D. 2 C.D. 1 Honorable Nadine K. Nakamura Speaker, House of Representatives Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Honorable Ronald D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular

D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE WOMEN'S COURT," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of

of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to (1) Make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent; (2) Establish and appropriate funds for a three-year Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the

Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference

Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii; (2) Requiring the Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under

Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (3) Changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900

Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 for fiscal year 2026-2027 for mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot

drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (5) Deleting language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court

the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit; (6) Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025; (7) Changing the sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third

Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit to June 30, 2027; and (8) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report,

your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D.

in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. as a pilot program; (B) Expand to include additional participants; (C) Provide additional services; or (D) Be discontinued. SECTION 5. D. Kouchi President of the Senate Thirty-Third State Legislature Regular Session of 2025 State of Hawaii Madam and Sir: Your Committee on Conference on the disagreeing vote of the House of Representatives to the amendments proposed by the Senate in H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL

H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, entitled: "A BILL FOR AN ACT RELATING TO THE WOMEN'S COURT," having met, and after full and free discussion, has agreed to recommend and does recommend to the respective Houses the final passage of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of

of this bill in an amended form. The purpose of this measure is to (1) Make the Women's Court Pilot Program in the First Circuit permanent; (2) Establish and appropriate funds for a three-year Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the

Kona division of the Third Circuit; and (3) Require the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference

Hilo division of the Third Circuit. Your Committee on Conference has amended this measure by: (1) Codifying the Women's Court Program in the First Circuit within the Hawaii Revised Statutes, rather than the Session Laws of Hawaii; (2) Requiring the Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under

Judiciary to be responsible for providing mental health services under the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (3) Changing the duration of the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900

Circuit from three years to two years; (4) Appropriating $514,900 for fiscal year 2025-2026 and $557,000 for fiscal year 2026-2027 for mental health, substance abuse treatment, and other services and equipment, and the establishment of one full-time equivalent temporary Kona drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot

drug court probation supervisor position for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit; (5) Deleting language that would have required the Judiciary to submit a report to the Legislature regarding the need for and the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court

the associated costs of a pilot program for Women's Court in the Second and Fifth Circuits and Hilo division of the Third Circuit; (6) Changing the effective date to July 1, 2025; (7) Changing the sunset date for the Women's Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third

Court Pilot Program in the Kona division of the Third Circuit to June 30, 2027; and (8) Making technical, nonsubstantive amendments for the purposes of clarity, consistency, and style. As affirmed by the record of votes of the managers of your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report,

your Committee on Conference that is attached to this report, your Committee on Conference is in accord with the intent and purpose of H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, as amended herein, and recommends that it pass Final Reading in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D.

in the form attached hereto as H.B. No. 727, H.D. 1, S.D. 2, C.D. 1. Respectfully submitted on behalf of the managers: ON THE PART OF THE SENATE ON THE PART OF THE HOUSE ____________________________ KARL RHOADS Chair ____________________________ DAVID A.
